meanings.sent1: She could not gainsay the fact that it was her turn to clean the dishes.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to gainsay everything his sister says.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to gainsay the dog's claim to the sunny spot by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: His actions gainsay his words, showing his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The evidence was overwhelming, leaving no room to gainsay the truth.

meanings.sent1: The students did not gainsay the teacher's decision to cancel the field trip.
meanings.sent2: It is not wise to gainsay your boss in front of the entire team.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to gainsay the bird's choice of nesting spot by chattering loudly.
meanings.sent4: The waves continued to gainsay the efforts of the sailors to reach the shore.
meanings.sent5: Her actions clearly gainsay her earlier promises to help.

meanings.sent1: He tried to gainsay the scientific theory with his own hypothesis.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer will gainsay any false accusations made against her client.
meanings.sent3: The child attempted to gainsay the bedtime rule by hiding under the covers.
meanings.sent4: The bright smile on her face gainsays the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The loud applause gainsays any doubts about the performer's talent.
